Key Match Events: Justyn-Henry Malloy’s eighth-inning sacrifice fly helped the Detroit Tigers rally from a 3-0 deficit to move closer to the postseason with a 4-3 win over the Rays.
Riley Greene singled, Matt Vierling drew a walk, and Keith tied the game with an RBI single.
Malloy lifted a fly ball to medium center, and Vierling easily beat Jose Siri’s throw to score the winning run.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said, 'We do believe in what we can accomplish.'
Rays manager Kevin Cash stated, 'That’s the last team in baseball that you want to give any momentum.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Detroit has won five straight games.
The Tigers are tied with Kansas City for the second and third American League wildcard spots, 2½ games ahead of Minnesota.
The Rays are already eliminated from playoff contention and fell two games behind the third-place Red Sox in the AL East.
The Rays’ record of consecutive winning seasons ended after six seasons.
The Rays need to sweep their season-ending series against the Red Sox to finish at.500.
